item.title: EPA Launches Technology Challenge for an Advanced Septic System Nitrogen Sensor
item.description: BOSTON - Today, the U.S. EPA and its partners launched a technology challenge for an Advanced Septic System Nitrogen Sensor. The total award pool for this phase is $55,000.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Analysis Shows Increased Toxic Chemical Releases in Rhode Island in 2015
item.description: BOSTON - EPA's most recent Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) data is now available for the reporting year of 2015. In Rhode Island, the reporting data show that overall releases of pollutants to the environment increased since the previous reporting year (2014).
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA is Accepting Nominations for 2017 Environmental Merit Awards
item.description: BOSTON - The U.S. EPA is now accepting nominations for the 2017 Environmental Merit Awards. Most of the awards will recognize environmental achievements during the past year.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: Settlement Reached at the Peterson/Puritan, Inc. Superfund Site in Cumberland and Lincoln, R.I.
item.description: BOSTON - A settlement estimated to be worth more than $40 million was announced today by the U.S. Department of Justice, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the Rhode Island Department of Environmental Protection (RIDEM).
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: Four New England Communities Get EPA Assistance to Meet Environmental Goals and Foster Economic Development
item.description: BOSTON - Two Massachusetts communities as well as a community in Connecticut and one in Rhode Island will receive technical assistance from the US Environmental Protection Agency to pursue development strategies that advance clean air, clean water, economic development and other
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Works with Two R.I. Communities to Improve Water Quality
item.description: BOSTON - Two recent administrative consent orders between EPA and the Towns of Johnston R.I. and North Providence, R.I.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: Rhode Island DEM to Receive $129,000 EPA Pollution Prevention Grant
item.description: BOSTON - The R.I. Dept. of Environmental Management (RI DEM) has been selected to receive $129,000 over two years as one of five Pollution Prevention grants being awarded by EPA's New England Regional Office for the FY2016-FY2017 Pollution Prevention Grants cycle.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Establishes Eastern Long Island Sound Site for Disposal of Dredged Sediment
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Awards Providence Group $91K to Advance Environmental Education in Rhode Island
item.description: BOSTON - A Providence, R.I. organization that will involve students in becoming smarter and better stewards of the environment was awarded $91,000 for environmental education by the US Environmental Protection Agency.
item.dc:creator: Region 01

item.title: EPA Awards $270K for Environmental and Health Projects in New England Communities
item.description: BOSTON - EPA has awarded 12 grants across New England under its 2016 Healthy Communities Grant Program, totaling approximately $270,566, to fund community projects addressing environmental and public health issues.
item.dc:creator: Region 01
